message: I was looking into GTD apps, and ideally I would like for it to be similar to OmniFocus, in terms of having contexts and project distinctions, but it doesn't have to really have any of it's other features. I would like to be able to sync it across iOS devices, and the web (accessible from basically any computer) and while a Mac app would be nice, it's not a necessity. Thanks a lot.
Try Wunderlist, it's free and syncs to the cloud
I really like the look and feel of wunderlist, and it's functionality, but it is missing the organization using sub-groups like projects and contexts.
@mergesort Agree, I use Things for my GTD-needs. But that hasn't any good sync yet..

@emiltorp Things came out with sync recently, but it's still in beta. Hopefully it'll be available to everyone soon. I used Things for a while, but it was too simplistic for me and now I use OmniFocus.
Wunderlist has won me over. The syncing across multiplatform apps, and the elegant interface keep me checking things off.  Haven't tried omnifocus though, so I'll be checking that one out now
Tried so many GTP-apps, found http://getflow.com and love it. You can delegate tasks to your co-workers which is epic for me. Switched from Remember the Milk to getflow.
hi ! We've done our hackason,haha ! this is our show !! http://apps.facebook.com/otonnect/
I have been using awesome note.  You are able to sync to google docs or evernote!

I don't think there is an iOS/Mac GTD combo I haven't tried. I avoided OmniFocus because of the price and I didn't like it when I tried the demo. But I gave it another chance, because so many smart people online swear by it. After a week of using and watching a bunch of screencasts, it clicked for me. Now I couldn't live without it. The sync is flawless, the perspectives are awesome ( watch Merlin Mann's MacWorld talk), and it's so easy to add stuff. I use the quirky entry shortcut on my Mac and the bookmarklet on iOS.  It will cost you $140 for all three versions and several hours to get the hang of it, but it's worth it.
